title: [SETUP-01] Create Repository Structure & Documentation Folders
body:
## Task ID
SETUP-01

## Description
Initialize Git repository structure with all required folders and documentation templates.

## Specification Link
- Constitution Principle I: Spec-Driven (foundation for all work)

## Prerequisites
None

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] GitHub repository created and initialized
- [ ] Folder structure exists: specs/001-finhub-report/, reports/, scripts/, tests/, documentation/, configurations/
- [ ] All template files copied and ready for modification
- [ ] README.md created with project overview and team contact info
- [ ] .gitignore configured (exclude .pbix temp files, passwords, local configs)

## Dependencies
- None
- Blocks: SETUP-02, SETUP-03, SETUP-04, SETUP-05, SETUP-06

## Effort Estimate
1 hour

## Verification
- Tree command shows all folders
- GitHub repo accessible by team

title: [SETUP-02] Create Environment Configuration Files
body:
## Task ID
SETUP-02

## Description
Document SSAS connection strings for Dev, UAT, Prod environments.

## Specification Link
- Constitution Principle IV: Governance (environment isolation)

## Prerequisites
- SETUP-01 (repository structure)
- SSAS servers identified

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] configurations/connections-dev.json created with Dev SSAS server/port
- [ ] configurations/connections-uat.json created with UAT SSAS server/port
- [ ] configurations/connections-prod.json created with Prod SSAS server/port
- [ ] All connection strings follow format: {environment, ssas_server, ssas_port, ssas_database, authentication}
- [ ] Credentials file template created: configurations/credentials-template.json (template only, no passwords)
- [ ] Documentation: connection-setup.md with usage instructions

## Dependencies
- Depends on: SETUP-01
- Blocks: SETUP-03, GOV-01

## Effort Estimate
1 hour

## Verification
- Connections validated via Test-NetConnection PowerShell
- Each environment server reachable on specified port

title: [SETUP-03] Initialize Power BI Project File
body:
## Task ID
SETUP-03

## Description
Create blank Power BI Desktop project file for report development.

## Specification Link
- US1: Power BI Dashboard
- FR-001: Connect to SSAS cube

## Prerequisites
- Power BI Desktop installed
- SETUP-01 (repository structure)

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] reports/FinHub_Summary.pbix created (blank report)
- [ ] File saved and committed to Git
- [ ] Report title added: FinHub Financial Summary Report
- [ ] One blank page created for visualizations

## Dependencies
- Depends on: SETUP-01, SETUP-02
- Blocks: DATA-05, VIZ-01

## Effort Estimate
30 minutes

## Verification
- .pbix file opens in Power BI Desktop without errors

title: [SETUP-04] Initialize Excel Template
body:
## Task ID
SETUP-04

## Description
Create Excel workbook template with three blank sheets.

## Specification Link
- US2: Excel Financial Report

## Prerequisites
- SETUP-01 (repository structure)

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] reports/FinHub_Summary.xlsx created with three sheets: Summary, by-Region, by-Department
- [ ] Sheet tabs labeled correctly
- [ ] Workbook saved and committed to Git
- [ ] Template file ready for Power Query connections

## Dependencies
- Depends on: SETUP-01
- Blocks: EXCEL-01

## Effort Estimate
30 minutes

## Verification
- Excel file opens without errors
- Sheet tabs visible and correctly named

title: [SETUP-05] Create PowerShell Script Stubs
body:
## Task ID
SETUP-05

## Description
Create skeleton PowerShell scripts for automation workflows.

## Specification Link
- US3: Automated Daily Refresh
- US4: Environment Promotion
- US5: Data Validation

## Prerequisites
- SETUP-01 (repository structure)
- PowerShell knowledge

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] scripts/refresh-schedule.ps1 created with parameter placeholder
- [ ] scripts/refresh-execute.ps1 created with stub functions
- [ ] scripts/validation-runner.ps1 created with validation logic template
- [ ] scripts/promotion-validator.ps1 created for promotion gates
- [ ] scripts/audit-logger.ps1 created for compliance logging
- [ ] All scripts have headers: Author, Date, Purpose, Usage
- [ ] Scripts committed to Git

## Dependencies
- Depends on: SETUP-01
- Blocks: REFRESH-01, PROMOTE-01

## Effort Estimate
45 minutes

## Verification
- Scripts parse without syntax errors
- powershell -NoProfile -File script.ps1 runs without errors

title: [SETUP-06] Set Up Git Branching & Workflows
body:
## Task ID
SETUP-06

## Description
Configure Git branches and GitHub pull request workflows for promotion gates.

## Specification Link
- Constitution Principle IV: Governance (approval processes)

## Prerequisites
- GitHub repository created

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Three main branches configured: dev, uat, main (Prod)
- [ ] Branch protection rules set:
  - [ ] dev: No protection (development)
  - [ ] uat: Requires 1 technical review
  - [ ] main: Requires 1 Data Governance lead review + status checks
- [ ] GitHub Actions workflow template created (validation on PR)
- [ ] Documentation: git-workflow.md explains branching strategy
- [ ] Team trained on workflow

## Dependencies
- Depends on: SETUP-01
- Blocks: PROMOTE-01

## Effort Estimate
1 hour

## Verification
- Attempt to push directly to main → blocked (requires PR + approvals)
- Create PR from dev → uat → allowed and visible

title: [GOV-01] Configure SSAS Connectivity Tests
body:
## Task ID
GOV-01

## Description
Verify SSAS cube accessible from all environments.

## Specification Link
- Constitution Principle III: Data Accuracy (validation at source)

## Prerequisites
- SETUP-02 (connection configs)
- IT access to SSAS servers

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Dev SSAS cube reachable via Windows authentication
- [ ] UAT SSAS cube reachable via Windows authentication
- [ ] Prod SSAS cube reachable via Windows authentication
- [ ] Test query executes: SELECT MEASURE('FinHub_Cube'.[TotalRevenue])
- [ ] Results logged: tests/ssas-connectivity-results.txt

## Dependencies
- Depends on: SETUP-02
- Blocks: DATA-01

## Effort Estimate
1 hour

## Verification
- Connection test script returns: [Dev] PASS | [UAT] PASS | [Prod] PASS

title: [GOV-02] Setup Audit Logging Framework
body:
## Task ID
GOV-02

## Description
Implement centralized logging for compliance and audit trail.

## Specification Link
- Constitution Principle IV: Governance (audit trail required)

## Prerequisites
- SETUP-01 (folder structure)
- SETUP-05 (PowerShell stubs)

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Log directory created: scripts/logs/
- [ ] Log format standardized: [TIMESTAMP] | [LEVEL] | [ENVIRONMENT] | [ACTION] | [USER] | [STATUS] | [MESSAGE]
- [ ] Example entries created and verified
- [ ] Log rotation policy: Archive logs > 90 days old
- [ ] scripts/audit-logger.ps1 implements logging to file
- [ ] Documentation: logging-standards.md

## Dependencies
- Depends on: SETUP-01, SETUP-05
- Blocks: REFRESH-01

## Effort Estimate
1.5 hours

## Verification
- Run test script; logs appear in correct format and location

title: [GOV-03] Configure Error Notification System
body:
## Task ID
GOV-03

## Description
Setup alerts for refresh failures and validation errors.

## Specification Link
- Constitution Principle IV: Governance (error handling)

## Prerequisites
- GOV-02 (logging configured)
- Organization email/Teams access

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Email template created: alert-email-template.txt
- [ ] Alert triggers on: Refresh failure, Validation failure, SSAS connection error
- [ ] Recipients: Data Admin team, Data Governance lead
- [ ] Alert format includes: Error message, timestamp, suggested action, escalation
- [ ] Teams webhook configured (if applicable): scripts/notify-teams.ps1
- [ ] Test alert sent and verified

## Dependencies
- Depends on: GOV-02
- Blocks: REFRESH-01

## Effort Estimate
1 hour

## Verification
- Trigger manual refresh failure → Alert email received within 5 minutes

title: [GOV-04] Setup Power BI Service Workspace & Security
body:
## Task ID
GOV-04

## Description
Create Power BI Service workspaces with proper access controls.

## Specification Link
- Constitution Principle IV: Governance (environment isolation)

## Prerequisites
- Power BI Service Premium or Pro licenses available

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Power BI Service workspaces created:
  - [ ] FinHub-Dev (development)
  - [ ] FinHub-UAT (staging)
  - [ ] FinHub-Prod (production)
- [ ] Access controls configured per environment
- [ ] Service principals / automation accounts configured for refresh
- [ ] Documentation: workspace-access-matrix.md

## Dependencies
- Depends on: GOV-03
- Blocks: PROMOTE-03

## Effort Estimate
1.5 hours

## Verification
- Users assigned to correct workspaces
- Finance team access verified

title: [DATA-01] Export SSAS Cube Schema & Documentation
body:
## Task ID
DATA-01

## Description
Document SSAS cube structure for reference and development.

## Specification Link
- Constitution Principle I: Spec-Driven (document all dependencies)

## Prerequisites
- GOV-01 (SSAS connectivity verified)

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] SSAS cube schema exported to text: tests/ssas-schema-export.txt
- [ ] Measure names documented: TotalRevenue, TotalCost, ProfitMargin
- [ ] Dimension names documented: Month, Region, Department
- [ ] Key hierarchies documented
- [ ] Reference document: documentation/ssas-cube-reference.md

## Dependencies
- Depends on: GOV-01
- Blocks: DATA-02

## Effort Estimate
1 hour

## Verification
- Schema file contains all expected measures/dimensions
- File is complete and readable

title: [DATA-02] Query SSAS Cube & Validate Measure Data
body:
## Task ID
DATA-02

## Description
Execute direct SSAS queries to verify measures return data.

## Specification Link
- FR-001: Cube contains TotalRevenue, TotalCost, ProfitMargin
- FR-002: Dimensions include Month, Region, Department

## Prerequisites
- GOV-01 (connectivity)
- DATA-01 (schema understood)

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Direct SSAS query executed for TotalRevenue: Returns non-null values
- [ ] Direct SSAS query executed for TotalCost: Returns non-null values
- [ ] Direct SSAS query executed for ProfitMargin: Returns non-null values
- [ ] Last 12 months filter applied: Data scope verified
- [ ] Finance department filter applied: Data reduced appropriately
- [ ] Results documented: tests/ssas-measure-validation.csv

## Dependencies
- Depends on: DATA-01
- Blocks: DATA-03

## Effort Estimate
1.5 hours

## Verification
- All three measures return data
- ProfitMargin ≈ TotalRevenue - TotalCost

title: [DATA-03] Verify SSAS Relationships & Hierarchies
body:
## Task ID
DATA-03

## Description
Confirm dimension relationships support filtering.

## Specification Link
- FR-004: Filtering works across all dimensions

## Prerequisites
- DATA-01, DATA-02

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Relationship verified: Fact → Month dimension (1-to-many)
- [ ] Relationship verified: Fact → Region dimension (1-to-many)
- [ ] Relationship verified: Fact → Department dimension (1-to-many)
- [ ] Test query with dimension filter returns correct subset
- [ ] Document relationships: documentation/ssas-relationships.md

## Dependencies
- Depends on: DATA-02
- Blocks: DATA-04

## Effort Estimate
1 hour

## Verification
- Filtering by any dimension correctly reduces data

title: [DATA-04] Create SSAS Baseline for Validation
body:
## Task ID
DATA-04

## Description
Execute comprehensive SSAS query and export baseline for validation testing.

## Specification Link
- Constitution Principle III: Data Accuracy (baseline required)
- US5: Data Accuracy Validation

## Prerequisites
- DATA-03

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Comprehensive SSAS query created: tests/ssas-query-complete.sql
- [ ] Query includes: All measures, all dimensions, Last 12 months, Finance only
- [ ] Results exported to CSV: tests/ssas-validation-baseline.csv
- [ ] Columns: Month, Department, Region, TotalRevenue, TotalCost, ProfitMargin
- [ ] Row count documented (expected ~1,847 rows)
- [ ] Data spot-checked: 5-10 random rows reviewed
- [ ] File size recorded

## Dependencies
- Depends on: DATA-03
- Blocks: DATA-05, PROMOTE-01

## Effort Estimate
1.5 hours

## Verification
- CSV file readable with all columns
- Row count matches expected
- Values align with business expectations

title: [DATA-05] Test Power BI SSAS Connection
body:
## Task ID
DATA-05

## Description
Connect Power BI to Dev SSAS cube and load data.

## Specification Link
- US1: Power BI Dashboard
- FR-001: Connect to SSAS cube

## Prerequisites
- SETUP-03 (Power BI project)
- DATA-04 (baseline ready)
- GOV-01 (connectivity verified)

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Power BI Desktop opened: reports/FinHub_Summary.pbix
- [ ] Data connection created: Get Data → Analysis Services → Dev SSAS
- [ ] SSAS cube selected: FinHub_Cube
- [ ] Data loaded into Power BI without errors
- [ ] Data pane shows all measures and dimensions
- [ ] Sample row count confirmed: ~1,800 rows
- [ ] Connection status: Green (no errors)

## Dependencies
- Depends on: SETUP-03, DATA-04, GOV-01
- Blocks: DATA-06, VIZ-01

## Effort Estimate
1.5 hours

## Verification
- Power BI model shows all measures/dimensions
- No connection errors
- Data visible in Data pane

title: [DATA-06] Verify Data Relationships in Power BI
body:
## Task ID
DATA-06

## Description
Ensure relationships auto-detected or manually create if needed.

## Specification Link
- FR-010: Relationships configured for filtering

## Prerequisites
- DATA-05

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Power BI Model view opened
- [ ] Relationships verified: Fact ←→ Month, Region, Department
- [ ] All relationships are 1-to-many cardinality
- [ ] No missing relationships causing measurement errors
- [ ] Manually created any missing relationships
- [ ] Test: Simple table (Month + TotalRevenue) displays correctly

## Dependencies
- Depends on: DATA-05
- Blocks: VIZ-01

## Effort Estimate
1 hour

## Verification
- Simple pivot table (Month × TotalRevenue) displays without errors

title: [VIZ-01] Create Line Chart - Monthly Total Revenue
body:
## Task ID
VIZ-01

## Description
Build line chart showing revenue trend over 12 months.

## Specification Link
- US1: Power BI Dashboard
- FR-011: Line chart displays monthly revenue trend

## Prerequisites
- DATA-06 (model relationships verified)

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Line chart visualization created and placed on report (left column, top)
- [ ] X-axis: Month dimension (chronological)
- [ ] Y-axis: TotalRevenue measure (SUM)
- [ ] Chart title: Monthly Total Revenue (16pt, Bold, Dark Blue #1F4E79)
- [ ] Line color: Dark Blue (#1F4E79)
- [ ] X-axis labels: Month names (Jan, Feb, etc.)
- [ ] Y-axis: Currency format ($) with 0 decimals
- [ ] Hover tooltip: Month: [Month], Revenue: $[Amount]
- [ ] Chart renders without errors
- [ ] Sample: 12 months displayed with expected values

## Dependencies
- Depends on: DATA-06
- Blocks: TEST-US1-01

## Effort Estimate
1 hour

## Verification
- Chart displays 12 monthly data points
- Values align with SSAS baseline ± $10K
- Formatting matches specification

title: [VIZ-02] Create Bar Chart - Profit Margin by Region
body:
## Task ID
VIZ-02

## Description
Build bar chart showing profit margin comparison across regions.

## Specification Link
- US1: Power BI Dashboard
- FR-012: Bar chart displays profit margin by region

## Prerequisites
- DATA-06

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Bar chart created and placed on report (right column, top)
- [ ] X-axis: ProfitMargin measure (SUM)
- [ ] Y-axis: Region dimension (categorical)
- [ ] Sorted by ProfitMargin descending (highest profit first)
- [ ] Chart title: Profit Margin by Region (16pt, Bold, Gray #555555)
- [ ] Bar color: Gray (#555555)
- [ ] X-axis: Currency ($) or percentage format
- [ ] Hover tooltip: Region: [Region], Profit: $[Amount]
- [ ] Chart renders without errors
- [ ] Sample: 4-5 regions displayed, sorted high-to-low

## Dependencies
- Depends on: DATA-06
- Blocks: TEST-US1-01

## Effort Estimate
1 hour

## Verification
- Chart shows one bar per region
- Bars sorted by height
- Values match SSAS baseline ± $10K

title: [VIZ-03] Create Table - Summary by Department
body:
## Task ID
VIZ-03

## Description
Build detailed summary table with all measures and dimensions.

## Specification Link
- US1: Power BI Dashboard
- FR-013: Table displays all financial data with sorting

## Prerequisites
- DATA-06

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Table visualization created and placed on report (full width, bottom)
- [ ] Columns: Month, Department, TotalRevenue, TotalCost, ProfitMargin
- [ ] Column widths optimized for readability
- [ ] Header row: Dark Blue (#1F4E79) background, White text, Bold
- [ ] Data rows: Alternating light gray (#F2F2F2) shading
- [ ] Number formatting:
  - [ ] TotalRevenue: $#,##0.00
  - [ ] TotalCost: $#,##0.00
  - [ ] ProfitMargin: $#,##0.00 or percentage
- [ ] Column headers sortable (click to sort)
- [ ] Default sort: By Month (chronological)
- [ ] Table renders without errors
- [ ] ~1,800 rows visible and scrollable

## Dependencies
- Depends on: DATA-06
- Blocks: TEST-US1-01

## Effort Estimate
1.5 hours

## Verification
- Table displays all 5 columns with correct data
- Headers formatted as Dark Blue/white
- Alternating row colors visible
- Rows sortable by column

title: [FILTER-01] Create Date Range Slicer
body:
## Task ID
FILTER-01

## Description
Add interactive date filter allowing users to customize date range.

## Specification Link
- US1: Power BI Dashboard
- FR-014: Date range filter with Last 12 months default

## Prerequisites
- VIZ-01, VIZ-02, VIZ-03 (visualizations complete)

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Date slicer inserted at top-left of report
- [ ] Slicer title: Date Range
- [ ] Slicer type: Date range selector (calendar or dropdown)
- [ ] Default filter: Last 12 months
- [ ] Slicer connected to all visualizations
- [ ] Interaction: Change date range → All visualizations update < 1 second ✅
- [ ] Select single month → All visualizations update correctly
- [ ] Slicer formatting: 12pt, Bold, readable

## Dependencies
- Depends on: VIZ-01, VIZ-02, VIZ-03
- Blocks: FILTER-02

## Effort Estimate
1 hour

## Verification
- Slicer visible; default Last 12 months
- Changing slicer updates all visualizations instantly
- Performance: < 1 second response

title: [FILTER-02] Create Department Multi-Select Slicer
body:
## Task ID
FILTER-02

## Description
Add department filter with Finance as default.

## Specification Link
- US1: Power BI Dashboard
- FR-015: Department filter with Finance as default

## Prerequisites
- FILTER-01

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Slicer inserted at top-center of report
- [ ] Slicer title: Department
- [ ] Slicer type: List or dropdown
- [ ] Departments populated: Finance, Operations, Sales, Marketing, HR
- [ ] Default selection: Finance only
- [ ] Multi-select enabled: Ctrl+click to select multiple
- [ ] Interaction: All visualizations update < 1 second
- [ ] Test: Click Finance → Finance only; Ctrl+click Sales → Finance + Sales
- [ ] Performance: < 1 second response

## Dependencies
- Depends on: FILTER-01
- Blocks: FORMAT-01

## Effort Estimate
1 hour

## Verification
- Slicer visible; Finance is default
- Multi-select works
- Visualizations update instantly

title: [FORMAT-01] Apply Corporate Branding & Colors
body:
## Task ID
FORMAT-01

## Description
Ensure all visualizations follow corporate brand standards.

## Specification Link
- Constitution Principle II: Reporting Standards (brand consistency)
- FR-016: Report uses corporate color palette and fonts

## Prerequisites
- FILTER-02 (all visualizations complete)

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Report page background: White (#FFFFFF)
- [ ] Report title: FinHub Financial Summary Report (18pt, Bold, Dark Blue)
- [ ] All chart titles formatted:
  - [ ] Line chart: Dark Blue (#1F4E79) ✅
  - [ ] Bar chart: Gray (#555555) ✅
  - [ ] Table header: Dark Blue (#1F4E79) ✅
- [ ] Table alternating rows: Light gray (#F2F2F2) ✅
- [ ] Number formatting applied globally
- [ ] Fonts: Consistent throughout (Arial or Calibri)
- [ ] Visual hierarchy: Clear size differences between titles/headers/data

## Dependencies
- Depends on: FILTER-02
- Blocks: TEST-US1-01

## Effort Estimate
1 hour

## Verification
- Report opens; all colors match specification
- Brand guidelines applied consistently

title: [TEST-US1-01] Test User Story 1 - Power BI Dashboard
body:
## Task ID
TEST-US1-01

## Description
Comprehensive testing of all US1 components and acceptance criteria.

## Specification Link
- US1: Power BI Dashboard (all acceptance scenarios)

## Prerequisites
- FORMAT-01

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Test: Data Load - Report opens without errors; all measures visible; ~1,800 rows
- [ ] Test: Line Chart - 12 months displayed; values match baseline; Dark Blue color; tooltip works
- [ ] Test: Bar Chart - 4-5 regions displayed; sorted by profit; Gray color; values match baseline
- [ ] Test: Table - 5 columns present; Dark Blue headers; alternating row colors; sortable; 1,800 rows scrollable
- [ ] Test: Date Slicer - Default Last 12 months; changing updates visualizations < 1s
- [ ] Test: Department Slicer - Default Finance; multi-select works; visualizations update < 1s
- [ ] Test: Performance - Report load < 3s; slicer interaction < 1s
- [ ] Test: Data Accuracy - Sample revenue values match SSAS ± $1,000; ProfitMargin calculation correct; Finance-only filter applied

## Dependencies
- Depends on: FORMAT-01
- Blocks: None (end of US1)

## Effort Estimate
1.5 hours

## Verification
- All tests pass
- User Story 1 complete

## Test Results Document
tests/us1-test-results.md

title: [EXCEL-01] Create Power Query Connection to SSAS (Excel)
body:
## Task ID
EXCEL-01

## Description
Setup Power Query in Excel to pull data from Dev SSAS cube.

## Specification Link
- US2: Excel Financial Report

## Prerequisites
- SETUP-04 (Excel template)
- DATA-04 (SSAS baseline)

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Excel workbook opened: reports/FinHub_Summary.xlsx
- [ ] Power Query editor: Data → Get Data → From SQL Server Analysis Services
- [ ] SSAS connection configured:
  - [ ] Server: analysis-dev.company.com
  - [ ] Database: FinHub_Cube
  - [ ] Authentication: Windows
- [ ] Query returns: Month, Department, Region, TotalRevenue, TotalCost, ProfitMargin
- [ ] Filter: Last 12 months, Finance department only
- [ ] ~1,800 rows expected
- [ ] Power Query formula documented

## Dependencies
- Depends on: SETUP-04, DATA-04
- Blocks: EXCEL-02

## Effort Estimate
1 hour

## Verification
- Power Query loads data from SSAS
- ~1,800 rows in Excel
- Columns match expected

title: [EXCEL-02] Create Summary Sheet
body:
## Task ID
EXCEL-02

## Description
Build Summary sheet with all raw data.

## Specification Link
- US2: Excel Financial Report (summary sheet)

## Prerequisites
- EXCEL-01

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Sheet renamed: Summary
- [ ] Data loaded from Power Query: ~1,800 rows
- [ ] Columns: Month, Department, Region, TotalRevenue, TotalCost, ProfitMargin
- [ ] Number formatting applied: $ for currency, % where applicable
- [ ] Header row: Dark Blue (#1F4E79) background, white text, bold
- [ ] Data rows: Alternating light gray (#F2F2F2)
- [ ] Column widths optimized for readability
- [ ] Freeze panes: Header row frozen
- [ ] Data sorted: By Month, then Department, then Region
- [ ] Totals row added (optional): sum of each measure

## Dependencies
- Depends on: EXCEL-01
- Blocks: EXCEL-03

## Effort Estimate
1 hour

## Verification
- Sheet contains all expected data
- Formatting matches standards
- Column widths readable

title: [EXCEL-03] Create by-Region Pivot Sheet
body:
## Task ID
EXCEL-03

## Description
Create pivot table or manual aggregation by region.

## Specification Link
- US2: Excel Financial Report (regional analysis)

## Prerequisites
- EXCEL-02

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Sheet renamed: by-Region
- [ ] Pivot structure: Rows (Regions), Columns (Months), Values (Revenue, Profit)
- [ ] Aggregation: SUM of revenue/profit per region per month
- [ ] Formatting: Dark Blue headers, Currency format, Alternating rows
- [ ] Totals row: Bottom shows sum per month
- [ ] Totals column: Right shows region total
- [ ] Values realistic: North ~$28.4M, South ~$14.8M, East ~$22.1M, West ~$12.1M (sample)

## Dependencies
- Depends on: EXCEL-02
- Blocks: EXCEL-04

## Effort Estimate
1.5 hours

## Verification
- Pivot displays regions × months
- Values match source data
- Totals correct

title: [EXCEL-04] Create by-Department Pivot Sheet
body:
## Task ID
EXCEL-04

## Description
Create department aggregation (Finance only per spec).

## Specification Link
- US2: Excel Financial Report (departmental analysis)

## Prerequisites
- EXCEL-03

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Sheet renamed: by-Department
- [ ] Pivot structure: Rows (Departments), Columns (Months), Values (Revenue, Cost, Profit)
- [ ] Finance-only data (per specification)
- [ ] Aggregation: SUM per department per month
- [ ] Formatting: Dark Blue headers, Currency format, Alternating rows
- [ ] Totals row: Bottom shows month totals
- [ ] Totals column: Right shows department total
- [ ] Likely only 1 row since filtered to Finance only

## Dependencies
- Depends on: EXCEL-03
- Blocks: EXCEL-05

## Effort Estimate
1.5 hours

## Verification
- Pivot displays department × months
- Finance-only filter applied
- Totals correct

title: [EXCEL-05] Create Refresh Data Button
body:
## Task ID
EXCEL-05

## Description
Add refresh mechanism for users to update data from SSAS.

## Specification Link
- US2: Excel Financial Report (refresh capability)

## Prerequisites
- EXCEL-04

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Button created: Refresh Data
- [ ] Placement: Top-left of Summary sheet
- [ ] Formatting: Bold text, visually prominent
- [ ] Button action: Refresh all Power Query connections
- [ ] Expected duration: < 2 minutes
- [ ] User instruction: Comment/note added to button
- [ ] Manual refresh also available: Right-click sheet → Refresh (Excel native)
- [ ] Optional: Refresh status indicator with timestamp

## Dependencies
- Depends on: EXCEL-04
- Blocks: TEST-US2-01

## Effort Estimate
1 hour

## Verification
- Click button → All sheets refresh
- Data updates with latest SSAS values
- Refresh completes < 2 minutes

title: [TEST-US2-01] Test User Story 2 - Excel Report
body:
## Task ID
TEST-US2-01

## Description
Validate Excel report functionality and accuracy.

## Specification Link
- US2: Excel Financial Report (all acceptance scenarios)

## Prerequisites
- EXCEL-05

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Test: File Opens - Excel file opens without errors; all 3 sheets visible
- [ ] Test: Summary Sheet - ~1,800 rows loaded; columns correct; formatting applied; header frozen
- [ ] Test: by-Region Sheet - Pivot displays regions × months; values aggregate; totals correct
- [ ] Test: by-Department Sheet - Pivot displays Finance × months; values match; totals correct
- [ ] Test: Refresh Button - Click → All sheets refresh; duration < 2 minutes; data updates
- [ ] Test: Data Accuracy - Spot-check 5 cells vs SSAS baseline ± $100; sum totals correct; Finance-only filter applied
- [ ] Test: Performance - File opens < 5 seconds; refresh < 2 minutes

## Dependencies
- Depends on: EXCEL-05
- Blocks: None (end of US2)

## Effort Estimate
1.5 hours

## Verification
- All tests pass
- User Story 2 complete

## Test Results Document
tests/us2-test-results.md

title: [REFRESH-01] Create PowerShell Refresh Execution Script
body:
## Task ID
REFRESH-01

## Description
Implement PowerShell script to refresh Power BI dataset and Excel workbook.

## Specification Link
- US3: Automated Daily Refresh
- FR-018: Daily automated refresh at 6 AM

## Prerequisites
- SETUP-05 (PowerShell stubs)
- GOV-02 (logging)
- GOV-03 (notifications)

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Script file: scripts/refresh-execute.ps1 completed
- [ ] Functionality:
  - [ ] Refresh Power BI dataset via REST API or Power BI Management Module
  - [ ] Refresh Excel Power Query (programmatically or via Excel COM)
  - [ ] Log refresh details: Start time, end, duration, status
  - [ ] Error handling: Retry logic (3 retries × 5 min interval)
  - [ ] Notification: Send alert email on failure
- [ ] Script parameters: -Environment (dev/uat/prod), -Force (optional)
- [ ] Sample output shows SUCCESS status and duration
- [ ] Error handling tested

## Dependencies
- Depends on: SETUP-05, GOV-02, GOV-03
- Blocks: REFRESH-02

## Effort Estimate
2 hours

## Verification
- Script runs without syntax errors
- Power BI dataset refreshes
- Logs written to file
- Alert sent on failure (tested)

## Performance Requirement
- Entire refresh < 15 minutes

title: [REFRESH-02] Configure Windows Task Scheduler
body:
## Task ID
REFRESH-02

## Description
Schedule PowerShell script to run daily at 6 AM.

## Specification Link
- US3: Automated Daily Refresh
- FR-019: Refresh runs daily at 6 AM

## Prerequisites
- REFRESH-01

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Windows Task Scheduler opened (taskschd.msc)
- [ ] New task created: FinHub-Daily-Refresh
- [ ] Trigger: Daily, 6:00 AM
- [ ] Action: Run PowerShell script refresh-execute.ps1 -Environment dev
- [ ] Run with highest privileges: Yes
- [ ] Run whether user logged in: Yes
- [ ] Service account: Has permissions for SSAS and Power BI
- [ ] Task enabled: Yes ✅
- [ ] Task history: Shows successful runs ✅
- [ ] Three tasks created: Dev, UAT, Prod (each environment)

## Dependencies
- Depends on: REFRESH-01
- Blocks: REFRESH-03

## Effort Estimate
1.5 hours

## Verification
- Tasks visible in Task Scheduler
- Tasks marked as Enabled
- Manual trigger test: Right-click → Run → Executes successfully

title: [REFRESH-03] Log Monitoring & Verification
body:
## Task ID
REFRESH-03

## Description
Setup monitoring of refresh logs and verify daily execution.

## Specification Link
- Constitution Principle IV: Governance (monitoring required)

## Prerequisites
- REFRESH-02, GOV-02 (logging configured)

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Refresh logs directory verified: scripts/logs/ contains daily logs
- [ ] Log file naming: refresh-[environment]-[date].log
- [ ] Log format matches specification with timestamps and status
- [ ] Monitoring procedure documented: documentation/refresh-monitoring-guide.md
- [ ] Alert threshold: >15 min warning, >20 min critical
- [ ] Automated log rotation: Archive logs >90 days old
- [ ] First scheduled refresh verified: Logs created

## Dependencies
- Depends on: REFRESH-02
- Blocks: TEST-US3-01

## Effort Estimate
1 hour

## Verification
- Log files present in correct format
- Rotation working (old logs archived)

title: [TEST-US3-01] Test User Story 3 - Automated Refresh
body:
## Task ID
TEST-US3-01

## Description
Validate refresh schedule and automation.

## Specification Link
- US3: Automated Daily Refresh (all acceptance scenarios)

## Prerequisites
- REFRESH-03

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Test: Manual Execution - Run script: PASS; Duration < 15 min; Log created
- [ ] Test: Scheduled Task - Visible in Task Scheduler; Enabled; Manual trigger executes
- [ ] Test: First 6 AM Refresh - Completes without errors; Log created; Data updated
- [ ] Test: Performance - Duration measured < 15 min; PBI load time after refresh < 3s
- [ ] Test: Error Handling - Simulate SSAS failure; Script detects; Alert sent; Retries work
- [ ] Test: Logging - All entries present; Format correct; Audit trail complete

## Dependencies

- Blocks: PROMOTE-01

## Effort Estimate
2 hours

## Verification
- All tests pass
- User Story 3 complete

## Test Results Document
tests/us3-test-results.md

title: [PROMOTE-01] Create Data Accuracy Validation Script
body:
## Task ID
PROMOTE-01

## Description
Build validation script comparing Power BI data to SSAS baseline.

## Specification Link
- US5: Data Accuracy Validation
- Constitution Principle III: Data Accuracy (0.01% tolerance)

## Prerequisites
- DATA-04 (baseline created)
- TEST-US1-01, TEST-US2-01 (reports complete)

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Script file: scripts/validate-powerbi-accuracy.ps1 created
- [ ] Functionality:
  - [ ] Load SSAS baseline: tests/ssas-validation-baseline.csv
  - [ ] Export Power BI data to CSV
  - [ ] Row-by-row comparison
  - [ ] Calculate variance: (PBI - SSAS) / SSAS × 100%
  - [ ] Flag discrepancies > 0.01% as FAIL
  - [ ] Generate report: tests/validation-report.html with comparisons
- [ ] Script parameters: -Environment, -TolerancePercent (0.01 default)
- [ ] Exit code: 0 (PASS) or 1 (FAIL)
- [ ] Report shows all rows with variance and status

## Dependencies
- Depends on: DATA-04, TEST-US1-01, TEST-US2-01
- Blocks: PROMOTE-02

## Effort Estimate
2 hours

## Verification
- Script runs without errors
- Validation PASS in Dev
- Report generated and readable

title: [PROMOTE-02] Create GitHub PR Workflow & Checklist
body:
## Task ID
PROMOTE-02

## Specification Link

- Constitution Principle IV: Governance (approval workflow)

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Mandatory sections: What changed, Why, Testing, Governance approval, Validation status
- [ ] Promotion checklist created: documentation/promotion-checklist.md
- [ ] Checklist items:
  - [ ] Data accuracy: PASS
  - [ ] All measures accurate
  - [ ] Dimensions present
  - [ ] Filters working
  - [ ] Visualizations render
  - [ ] Performance targets met
  - [ ] Brand compliance
  - [ ] Refresh operational
- [ ] GitHub Actions workflow: .github/workflows/validate-on-pr.yml
- [ ] Action runs validation on PR merge attempts

## Dependencies
- Depends on: SETUP-06
- Blocks: PROMOTE-03

## Effort Estimate
1.5 hours

## Verification
- PR template visible on PR creation
- Checklist complete and clear
- GitHub Actions runs on PRs

title: [SEC-01] Configure Power BI Row-Level Security
body:
## Task ID
SEC-01

## Description
Implement RLS to restrict Finance-only access in Prod.

## Specification Link
- Constitution Principle IV: Governance (access control)
- FR-022: Row-level security restricts data by department

## Prerequisites
- PROMOTE-04 (Prod deployment)

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Power BI Prod dataset opened
- [ ] RLS role created: Finance_Only
  - [ ] DAX filter: [Department] = Finance
  - [ ] Applied to all tables
- [ ] Test users assigned:
  - [ ] Finance team: Can view all Finance data ✅
  - [ ] Other users: Cannot access or see empty data ✅
- [ ] RLS testing documented
- [ ] Documentation: documentation/rls-configuration.md

## Dependencies
- Depends on: PROMOTE-04
- Blocks: SEC-02

## Effort Estimate
1.5 hours

## Verification
- RLS role visible in Power BI Service
- Users correctly assigned
- Access control tested and working

title: [SEC-02] Setup Audit Logging for Power BI
body:

SEC-02

  - [ ] Sharing: Who shared with whom
- [ ] Logs retained: Minimum 90 days
- [ ] Searchable: By user, date, action
- [ ] Access for Governance team configured
- [ ] Process documented: documentation/audit-log-access.md
- [ ] Sample entries visible and correct

- Blocks: SEC-03

1.5 hours

- Sample entries captured
- Searchable and accessible

- [ ] Emergency procedures: documentation/emergency-procedures.md

  - [ ] Escalation contact for security incidents
- [ ] Compliance doc: documentation/compliance-checklist.md

  - [ ] SOX: Audit trail requirements (if applicable)
